page.title: 02Tourism
page.content: Tourists generally visit the Church with its 14th century pew-ends. Opposite Church is Church House where you may obtain teas during the summer period. Visitors may stay at the Carew Arms or one of the bed and breakfast establishments. There is a caravan site at Flaxpool catering for touring caravans, and a Youth Hostel provides for parties of school parties, some of whom are from overseas. Many walkers and pony trekkers are attracted o the Quantock Hills. The West Somerset Staghounds are the local Hunt, and the Meet assembles at the Carew Arms in Crowcombe several times a year, providing a colourful spectacle. The West Somerset Morris Men also give displays on some Bank Holidays.
